title: Florida abortion ban: How lawmakers voted on bill limiting abortion
description: The Florida legislation that bans abortions in the state after 15 weeks was passed in each chamber, unsurprisingly, on party lines.
text_headers:
Florida bill bans abortions at 15 weeks. How did Florida lawmakers vote?
How Florida senators voted on the abortion bill
text: Florida abortion ban: How lawmakers voted on bill limiting abortionNews Sports Entertainment Opinion Email Us Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals  STATEFlorida bill bans abortions at 15 weeks. How did Florida lawmakers vote?Capital BureauUSA TODAY NETWORK FLORIDAThe Florida legislation that bans abortions in the state after 15 weeks was passed in each chamber, unsurprisingly, on party lines. Thursday, every Republican in the Senate voted up on the bill (HB 5) and every Democrat was opposed. One Republican, Sen. Ileana Garcia of Miami, missed the vote but later recorded a 'yes.'Last month in the House, two Democrats missed the 78-39 vote there on final passage: Reps. Anika Omphroy of Lauderdale Lakes and Michele Rayner of St. Petersburg. They later voted 'no,' however.  Thursday's vote:Florida lawmakers send 15-week abortion ban to Gov.
